channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: DHB urges government to avoid Queenstown for isolation due to healthcare
item.description: Southern DHB is pushing for Dunedin and Invercargill to be used for managed isolation ahead of Queenstown, due to concerns about its lack of medical facilities.

item.title: National MP Hamish Walker admits leaking Covid-19 patient details
item.description: Acting chief executive of Auckland Rescue Helicopter Trust Michelle Boag has confirmed she gave the patient details to Walker.

item.title: Awatere River strewn with rubbish after flooding into old landfill
item.description: People have been collecting the rubbish from the riverbanks and nearby beaches after the Awatere River cut into the old landfill.

item.title: Air NZ may extend bookings freeze - chief executive Greg Foran
item.description: Air New Zealand is not ruling out extending its three-week freeze on bookings to help with the squeeze on the managed isolation of returning travellers, its chief executive says.

item.title: Haami Hanara's victim: 'Hand yourself in'
item.description: The former partner of a murder victim is calling for the killer - who is on the run - to hand himself in.

item.title: Renewed call for Key to apologise over 'jihadi brides' claim
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says it's not her place to decide if Sir John Key should apologise over false claims brides were leaving New Zealand for ISIS in 2015.

item.title: Two new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand - Minister Hipkins
item.description: The new cases are a woman in her 20s and a woman in her 30s, both from the same family, who arrived 2 July from Afghanistan.

item.title: Labour and NZ First at loggerheads over Auckland port move
item.description: Transport Minister and senior Labour MP Phil Twyford has joined forces with his former colleague and now Auckland Mayor Phil Goff against New Zealand First and the party's push to move the port north.

item.title: Government extends temporary work visas by six months
item.description: The government is extending temporary work visas by six months for some migrants already onshore, Immigration Minister Iain Lees-Galloway has announced.

item.title: Meth ring investigation leads to arrests, charges
item.description: Methamphetamine, a loaded shotgun and ammunition were seized today as police targeted a drug supply operation in Nelson and Marlborough.

item.title: Climate change effects on NZ fishers 'dire' under 4C warming - report
item.description: Climate change could lead to a 24 percent reduction in fish species and more storms, which could damage aquaculture farms and sink fishing boats.

item.title: Arrest in relation to fatal hit and run in Manurewa
item.description: A 27-year-old man has been arrested and charged after an elderly man was killed in a hit and run incident in Manurewa last month.

item.title: Air NZ putting a temporary hold on new international bookings to NZ
item.description: The government and Air New Zealand have agreed to manage bookings to ensure New Zealanders arriving home can be safely placed in a managed isolation or quarantine facility.

item.title: Married couple unsure why visa to NZ was denied
item.description: A Kiwi motor racing champion is struggling to understand why his wife is repeatedly being denied permission to enter the country.

item.title: Auckland rates rise options more popular than freeze - council survey
item.description: Nearly two thirds of Aucklanders back a rates increase over a rates freeze, new figures from the council show.

item.title: RSA held service outside memorial due to bell tower safety fears
item.description: The RSA has resorted to holding services outside the National War Memorial in Wellington as the strengthened Carillon tower is still earthquake-prone.

item.title: Police officer justified in shooting man who had knife - IPCA
item.description: A police officer who shot and injured a man in Blenheim who nearly made off with a patrol car a year ago has been cleared of wrongdoing.

item.title: Phillip John Smith takes Corrections to court over visitation
item.description: The convicted murderer and child sex offender appeared via video link for a judicial review after Corrections would not to allow family members to visit him in prison.
